reviews.review_msg: Overall, Jason is a great prof! He is easy to get in touch, quite helpful with the assignments, and the weekly discussion posts plus the quizzes are easy. Except everything matters on literally who your TA is for this class, mine was Harsh. Horrible, literally graded the final paper so unfairly, barely responded to emails, marked harshly.

biweekly quizzes, weekly discussion posts + respond to peers. the word count did seem a little much but not too bad. hard to get full marks for discussion posts as the TA was kinda nitpicky over little things. reflection paper wasn't bad (1500 words). just make sure to follow all criteria carefully and this class can be a good gpa booster.

The prof seems fine, but I never contacted him. This course was frustrating, TAs dock points for tiny stuff, participation grading felt unfair, and weekly discussions are strict. If you want HUM electives, avoid this course: too many rules and annoying grading. Textbook purchase was mandatory (very boring & confusing book btw)
Teachers is okay, but the TA are the WORST, ESPECIALLY JOSEPH KUSI.
I could have had a better experience with him. He marks my work unfairly.

Jason not only cares about what he is teaching, but he also cares about his students. As an applied science student, I found him to be a breath of fresh air at SFU. I really wish there were more profs like him out there. Thank you Jason:)

His in-person classes were boring, I was lost/confused 70% of the time lol. His tone was sometimes condescending but last class did buy pizza for us + provided study guide questions for midterm/final (quite helpful). Bought the $80 e-textbook (there's also free library copies I think) for the discussion questions to answer for the reading responses

Very monotonous, very slow lectures. Had us write around 800 words for discussion posts per week which felt like a bit too much for an online class. His grading criteria was not clear at all. Wasn't accommodating to requests to alter final essay topic if initial topic was unfeasible. When sent an email, his tone in the reply would come off as rude.

Your grade depends on whos marking your stuff-make sure to look at the rubric cuz they take marks off for little things. Lectures are very long and he is pretty vague and it can come off as rude when he replies so take this course in person instead so your questions get answered properly. Easy course good elective. quizzes include little details.
lemme tell u wsp! this class is mostly discussion based w some quizzes! they r open-book, so take good notes. as a prof he is caring and learning abt religion was so cool! thank u jason.
Fun course overall, wasn't too harsh at marking. Good gpa booster
Boring lectures
Extremely rude in emails, which sucks cause it's fully online. Not understanding of others needs.
Extremely rude prof when responding to emails. Does not show students care and attention.

Jason is very personable and likes to connect with his students. Assignments are easily manageable, midterm & final are a snap if you study. Make an effort, participate in class, and you will do well. He was very accommodating when my seasonal job conflicted with tutorials. An enjoyable & interesting course, well worth taking no matter your major!

Jason was a good professor. His lectures were interesting and he was a kind prof. Your grade is based on a midterm worth 25%,written reading responses 25%, participation 25%, and the final 25%. To be honest both exams were quite easy and based on lecture notes. Just make sure to participate in the tutorials as that can make/ break your grade!

Best prof at SFU. Not only is his class super interesting and teaches you a lot, but he's a super understanding and chill guy. He genuinely really cares about his students and has such a positive and friendly energy. Couldn't recommend him enough.

There are quite a bit of stuff to read but he doesn't make it mandatory to read every single thing. He allows us to pick and choose whatever is interesting, and wrtie a discussion post answering a question from the textbook.
You'll be missing out if you leave SFU before taking a class with Jason. Cannot recommend enough.
Such a chill class HUM 130. Jason legit made it chill the class so I could focus on other classes. The discussion are fine and the quizzes are so easy.

This is the best professor I've had. He's passionate about what he teaches and is very kind. The workload isn't bad there's quite a bit of reading but it's not a hard course. Would take one of his classes again.

s a first year, this was my first A+. I'm happy i decided to be in this course with him, he is a god. i was on probation and managed to get my gpa higher than i expected. this course had really saved me. it also really depends on your TA. For sure a gpa booster!

Dr. Brown is so kind and caring, his lectures are very interesting and he's very quick to reply to emails and very helpful. The class is definitely a GPA booster, I would 100% recommend you take this course. I would love to have Dr. Brown as a professor again, he is very fair and grading was also very fair, guidelines were very clear.

I would take another course w him in the future. He is organized, communicative and caring. He writes nice announcements reminding us to enjoy the learning process instead of stressing on our mark. He feels more like a friend rather than an authoritative power hungry prof that many SFU staff are like. He even made a field trip for  the online class
chill dude. asmr voice. nice beard. LOTS OF READING BE READY.

jason is a chill professor whom I wish I could take an in-person class with. he's a laid-back guy who seems to love what he teaches (and it shows). the online class had weekly discussion posts, bi-weekly quizzes and a creative final paper. even when I got a poor mark on a quiz it was very easy to bump up the grade with later assignments.

Dr Brown is one of the best profs I have ever had.  So caring and kind and his passion is evident.  You will get out what you put into this class.  Reflect honestly and share your opinions and you will find this course so enriching.  If you are taking this class as a cheap credit you may find it a drag.

Jason's class policies were very flexible and the workload was manageable even while taking 5 classes and working 2 jobs. There is a lot of reading required for assignments but as long as you complete them and show up to/pay attention in class, you will do amazing! He is incredibly caring and accessible outside class - the best prof I have had

super nice would highly rec him, dry sense of humour,10/10. ppl saying quizzes were hard (online) when u could've just searched them up or had slides next to u when u do them. easy. he takes attendances in class and during tut, the TA was a little picky with marks, tut discussions were fun and concepts were laid nicely, ending project was the best

The quizzes were a bit difficult but the majority of the marks are based on the final essay (only 2500 words) and discussion posts. You can tell Dr.Brown really cares about the course and enjoyed teaching. With consistent lecture participation and textbook review, it's really easy to get a good mark.

Best prof I've had so far, super kind and friendly. 500 word weekly writes based on textbook chapters are worth it because he makes class surprisingly enjoyable; you can tell he is passionate about the topics and cares about his students.

Not only an amazing prof but overall human being. He made lectures easy and fun even tho it was dense at times. Genuinely cares about his students; he will sit with students before/after class and ask how everyone is doing. U will have to write weekly in this course which may take time bc you have to read relevant sections of the textbook.

Dr. Brown is super caring and great at teaching! His lectures are informative and exciting, and you can tell he is passionate about the topic. The only thing I found difficult about this course were the quizzes since there were time restrictions and you have to know your material to do well. Overall would highly recommend it!
easy marker and Chill.
I don't know what people who give one or two think, this is the best professor I've ever met.
One of the most caring professors I've ever had! He takes the time to check up on the students, send out reminders about quizzes, etc. A very lenient marker as well! Really enjoyed taking the class

Lots of weekly writing for a 100 level course, there are probably other gpa boosting classes to take with less work. Nonetheless hes an easy marker and a very caring prof. He always comes around and asks students how they are doing at the beginning of lecture which is rare. Material is interesting although the lectures themselves can be boring.

Unbearably boring lectures and an unnecessary amount of work for a first year class. What could be an interesting class becomes bogged down by the way he structures the course as well as his monotone voice.
I loved this class and the way it was set up. The grading was fair and the course content was interesting. Ended up being a GPA booster for me!

The lectures were a bit monotone and lacklustre, but regardless Jason made this class very interesting. There was a bit more work than I've seen for a 100 level course, but it also wasn't overly difficult. Very caring guy who understands theres a lot going on in the world right now

Although his course was a bit heavy, I thoroughly enjoyed how professional, structured, and clear the course was. Dr. Brown really works hard at creating a great learning environment, even sending out thoughtful weekly summaries. I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Professor Brown was really awesome. He made the topic (religious studies) super fascinating. He is a super caring guy and makes you want to learn more about the topic and participate. The textbook reading was about 2-4 hours a week and a 750 word reading reflection every week. For the final you can write a short story!

LOVE this prof!!! such a kind and caring guy. Took this class for a hum credit and ended up really loving it. Few quizzes, no midterm, final paper and one project . i did this course online so im not sure how it would differ in person. Jason is such an interesting guy and has really interesting stories to tell! quite a bit of reading but good!

Jason is so nice and actually cares about the students. If you need extensions he is always happy to help you out if needed. The class is a lot of writing but it is marked fairly they just take a few hours to complete. the quizzes are pretty straight forward but some questions can be tricky and don't seem to be covered before. 10/10 recommend Jason

He is lenient about late assignment and quizzes. Assignments every week to finish>500 words. Easy to do if you have a organized schedule and understand the questions. Quizzes based on slides not lectures.

This class is very interesting, but there is quite a bit of weekly work. There is a reading response and discussion due each week, but as long as you complete them it is easy to get 100% in these sections. There are quizzes every two weeks which are very difficult and count for a large portion of your grade. Otherwise there are no exams.

Whoever recommended this class for credits must have been joking. The only good thing about this course is no exams, but other than that prepare to memorize a ton of useless religious material (unless you're into that kinda thing). Professor also did nothing except for assigning crazy amount of weekly readings + mocked student after asking Q
Three midterms, marked out of 10, results in many students getting poor marks. Lectures long and detailed, it was difficult to stay engaged. Talks all of lecture, tutorials are much better.

Amazing teacher! Honestly went in this class for my breadth but came out super interested in the topic. The field projects may seem annoying to do but they honestly changed me. He allows for great discussions in tutorials and really just wants people to leave with religious literacy and does not push any ideals at all. Do take!

Such a great prof, super funny and caring for his students, which I find rare in university! He speaks really quietly but makes the lectures super interesting and funny. Definitely would take a class with him again!
